place_description: Monarch Market is a destination for crafted culinary experiences in the center of Uptown Charlotte featuring 13 vendors, 1 full-service restaurant, 3 bars and private event space.

reviews_data.review_text: The food quality is mediocre and not worth the price. Service sucks too! LOOK AT YOUR RECEIPT PEOPLE! Monarch Market is ripping customers off red handed. There are 4 different taxes and a service fee on the receipt. The cashier could not explain all of the EXTRA TAXES AND FEES. The only place that has the audacity to blatantly steal from their customers is Monarch Market. My receipts from other restaurants in the area charge an appropriate single NC tax. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!
Great indoor food hall in downtown NC. There was a great variety of selections.

Sat at the open bar out front because I thought it was a neat concept.  After waiting 12 minutes and the bartender looking at me three times without saying a word I left.   Don't waste your time or money going to the bar.
Morgan was our server and we had the best Tommy and Helen margaritas ever! Thank you Morgan and you will see us again soon!

Our first lunch visit. We walked the options and settled on Barley and Burger. The wait time from joining the line, ordering, and getting the food was decent but keep in mind it was a Friday holiday. I got the Truffle Shuffle and fried pickles.Yum! As others have rightly pointed out, come prepared to pay above average prices and how much you get to enjoy the environment may depend on when you make the trek. I think it will be worth the occasional walk for us.

*Another visit. Kuya Omakase and their rainbow roll. We've learned to order online and pick it up at the concierge.

It's a good spot to grab lunch at work since you and your coworkers can split up to order and then meet up to eat. Love the variety of options, but all of the food is just okay. I've been a couple of times, and have not had anything beyond mediocre.

I understand everyone wants to go home, but please stop closing establishments before closing time... I went up to one 30 minutes before closing to a particular restaurant and they were cleaning and told me they weren't serving anymore. It's very annoying! Also, lower the prices!

Monarch is nice inside but the "small fee" is 4.5% of what you are purchasing. Not worth it when there are plenty of other restaurants and bars to frequent in uptown. For definition, small is not half of the tax charged already on my purchase. It's maybe 1-2%.
So paying for your rent. Additionally, they don't validate parking so on top of your 4.5%, you get the privilege of paying for that too. I will not be back. I have also spread the word to other coworkers so they know "small" is not truly small.
Un lugar super recomendable.  Muchas y buenas opciones gastronomicas sin necesidad de gastar demasiado. Muy buen ambiente
Lots of options in one location
Came into MM at 8:38 and all of the vendors were gone.... Even though the signs say they close at 9pm.

Great for groups! I work down the street, and this newer Uptown food hall has always been a crowd pleaser. There are about 10 restaurants and 2-3 bars with a wide variety of options - so far,  they have all been great and made fresh to order. From sushi to smash-burgers to sandwiches and salads, all done very well. Plenty of seating for groups.

Take-out ordering is easy through their website.
El Veneno is the best spot in Monarch Market by far. Almost every spot is good but El Veneno is next level.

Was staying downtown and ordered delivery through their website. Only 1 of my two meals were delivered and bag was still stapled shut so I assume it must have been on business side. Have been trying to reach out with no response.
Beautiful just Beautiful.....will be back. There's a restaurant in there that serves "Lobster" rolls and that was dangerous good.
Great place for lunch or dinner.  Grab a drink at the outside bar in a relaxed atmosphere.

Falafel Plate from Monarch Market, look how good it looks and sounds on the website order menu. So, I get my food, and it has zero of the delicious "served with" items listed. No hummus, no salad, no pickles, no tahini sauce, no pita bread just DRY falafel patties. I go back to question this, the server says all the served with items are add-ons, extra charge. I show her the menu and she said they have that listed wrong on the website.

I love a food hall especially when it's in the heart of uptown and right across the street from Blumenthal.  My wife and I frequently attend shows at Blumenthal and often times try to tie in a dinner or drinks before the show.  I prefer to find something within walking distance which there are several options but Monarch has just expanded those options exponentially.

Our first trip to Monarch was towards the end of summer/ early fall where the outdoor bar was still open. We unknowingly saw the open bar from across the street and decided to grab a few drinks.  It was then that we realized there are several food options.  We had just eaten so we settle on a couple of drinks with the promise that we would return to try the food.  The bar was great as the servers were quick and the drinks were good.  We didn't have any custom cocktails so not much to rate other than they had a great selection.  They have custom cocktails available but we didn't get any.

On our second visit to Monarch we planned to eat dinner and take advantage of the many options.  I landed on Maroon Market which I was quickly disappointed.  I tried to order several things and everything i tried to order they were out of.  This was very frustrating but I'll give them another shot on my next visit and hopefully they will be better stocked.

Since I couldn't get what I wanted at Maroon Market I slide a couple of spots down to Seoul Good which was a great experience.  The lady service was super nice and helpful.  We ordered one of their custom corndogs (half cheese half corn dog) which was an interesting concept.  They have additional options of breading that range from panko to crumbled hot cheetos (or something similar).  These were actually much better than I expected.  I also ordered the tofu rice bowl.  I wasn't a fan of how the tofu was cooked but overall it was a delicious meal and very filling.

I love a food hall especially when it's in the heart of uptown and right across the street from Blumenthal.  My wife and I frequently attend shows at Blumenthal and often times try to tie in a dinner or drinks before the show.  I prefer to find something within walking distance which there are several options but Monarch has just expanded those options exponentially.

Our first trip to Monarch was towards the end of summer/ early fall where the outdoor bar was still open. We unknowingly saw the open bar from across the street and decided to grab a few drinks.  It was then that we realized there are several food options.  We had just eaten so we settle on a couple of drinks with the promise that we would return to try the food.  The bar was great as the servers were quick and the drinks were good.  We didn't have any custom cocktails so not much to rate other than they had a great selection.  They have custom cocktails available but we didn't get any.

On our second visit to Monarch we planned to eat dinner and take advantage of the many options.  I landed on Maroon Market which I was quickly disappointed.  I tried to order several things and everything i tried to order they were out of.  This was very frustrating but I'll give them another shot on my next visit and hopefully they will be better stocked.

Since I couldn't get what I wanted at Maroon Market I slide a couple of spots down to Seoul Good which was a great experience.  The lady service was super nice and helpful.  We ordered one of their custom corndogs (half cheese half corn dog) which was an interesting concept.  They have additional options of breading that range from panko to crumbled hot cheetos (or something similar).  These were actually much better than I expected.  I also ordered the tofu rice bowl.  I wasn't a fan of how the tofu was cooked but overall it was a delicious meal and very filling.
Food was decent. We had the tandoori chicken.
good place

Loved coming by Monarch Market on my trip to Charlotte, I'll definitely be back! A huge variety of food is available and you can take it to sit and eat at any of their bars. My bartender, Danny was super knowledgeable and even made me a specialty cocktail based on my tastes.

Cute place and great meet up spot after work. Aesthetically pleasing and bright. A lot of food choices. It's our go to stop when going to a concert at spectrum because there's something for everyone! Food quality at certain vendors are hit and miss is my only warning. It can also be a little pricey but what isn't in Uptown? The bar has great fresh cocktails, but won't lie 2 margaritas for $50 bucks is a little wild!

This is a lovely location with a great environment. The staff here is very nice and understanding with you and the food is top tier.I would recommend this place to anyone looking to try something new in uptown.
I loved the food and all of the drink options
Great environment, service and drinks are always good.
Went after a football game and everyone was so nice. The atmosphere and drinks were great

Absolutely obsessed!

Favorite bartenders: Mel & Mason!!

Mel normally takes care of me & clients in the day and Mason handles the evening. Either way, either shift--they are both BEYOND STELLAR! I come to Monarch only for them! And also, for the Cajun pasta @ Pasta Crush! lol.
The bar service was so quick and the drinks were outstanding. 10/10 would recommend. Our bartender Morganne was very welcoming and gave awesome service.

This place and the employees and the managers that work at this is establishment are rude and disorderly The food that's served at this establishment is not that good at all the food served here is overly priced and is in the category of mediocre tasting food the bartenders are very rude and not that knowledgeable at all in overall, the service at this establishment is poor and I wouldn't I recommend going to this place or taking your family or kids this place is not kid friendly either I give Monarch market a BIG NO

This place is fantastic. My son is still talking about the burger he had and I had an amazing salad. So many places and exciting dishes to choose from. It is essentially a fancy food court to me, which gives plenty of eating options. Unfortunately I only took a picture of my salad to share that was alongside a sandwich.

I recently held a birthday party at Aster Cocktail Room at Monarch Market. Bartenders were great in getting everyone drinks timely, the food was awesome (lobster rolls and truffle oil Swiss cheese sliders particularly). The service was terrific, they accommodated all our requests and we had such a great time. Highly recommend for an upscale cocktail party!

Our group had a nice event at Monarch Market last week .  Katie at Hospitality HG helped us plan the event, set up the food and worked to make sure everyone had a great time. Everyone really liked the food!
Katie was amazing!   She went above and beyond to make sure our event attendees enjoyed finishing out their night.
Such a fun spot to take friends to if you can't decide what to eat! Several super yummy restaurants inside all with incredibly nice staff!

Insanely overpriced for what you get.  I ordered the crispy orange chicken bowl and was 4 thin delivers of chicken, a massive bowl of over cooked rice and a few cheap greens.    Over $20 for this slop?  No way will I be back.
Great place to eat

Will highlight individual restaurants I have ate with at multiple times. But today just like every day when I come to the bar they seem miserable, but today I was ignored and even after I sat down and waited a guest was greeted and offered a menu before I was the two lightskin girls stayed on their phones laughing and talking crap and still never got help

The food is on the pricey side for what you get, and the quality is okay. I won't be going back because of all the extra sales tax added on. I'm guessing it's a Marriott thing, because what even is a county tax?! The food already cost too much, and then you're adding an extra 5 lines of taxes, AND y'all still expect a tip after all that?! Maybe start putting all those taxes into some wages. So far, this is the only place I know of in Charlotte that taxes you SO HARD for no reason!

It's a great place for downtown with a number of options. The food was okay. My son and husband had burgers, and my daughter got spaghetti and meatballs, which were super salty. I got the grilled ginger chicken bowl with white rice and Kung poa sauce. We spent about $25 per person just know that you are paying for the location, not the food.
Fantastic food!
They have great Dim Sum, and they will even fry it for you! Really good addition to Monarch.
What a lovely place. Great atmosphere, very good stands of food al over the world and very friendly. Prices are high but tast good.

Had a large take out order, one of my coworkers items were missing, the to-go desk folks walked where we needed to go and got it fixed, no questions asked. The environment is upbeat, food was delicious.

Food just fair.  I mean I can go and get chicken fingers/nuggets anywhere.  All  other food was smashed burgers, italian, asian.  It was very expensive for courtyard food.  $17-$20 per person.
There is no service.  Just order and pick up.  Atmosphere is nice.   Modern and clean and just like a upscale food court.  I like the ideal of the inside and outside bars but we went to the bar to get a Titos and soda and they didn't have Titos???? Really??? Only Pinnacle.  Very limited on drink selections.  We will not be going here again.  I say go once and see what it's about.  Not worth a repeat visit.

Sushi art for the win! Thank you. We ordered a late lunch, our food was ready on time, it was very easy to locate the concierge and head out.  It is easy to park down the way, hop on the gold line for a free quick ride to Trade & Tryon (avoiding the heavy traffic in the area) and enjoy the delicious rolls
Good variety food court.  Long wait lines for some.  Expensive.  Good food.
Very nice selection of restaurants but nothing really great. It's worth a visit for sure!
Definitely worth it!!
Just Chicken....wife wanted.i didn't even have a taste for them and was still good..
Talk about drinking on the front porch in down town Charlotte, it's something you need to do.
A bit $ but lots of food options. The Shawarma plate at one place was so-so. The pot sticker soup at another was ok.
Lots of food vendor options and decent sized seating area.
Sushi was a 10/10 all three times I've gone!

We are visiting for the weekend and drove an extra 40 minutes to try this location. We got several different things to give it a try. Sushi art and sol something (chicken bop) was the only thing we liked. Kabob (what we got we did not like) however their green sauce ! AMAZING!

overall not a place I will want to visit again unless it's meeting friends and a drink. The drinks I did see looked good.

To put it in perspective. We went here with high expectations but were disappointed by 1) the parking 2) the amount of food given 3) the price it added up to

You're paying for the atmosphere. I had 3 items as we thought it was be enough for a meal for two and it came up to $35 without drinks we got 4 chicken wings, a side salad, and some mushroom dish for $36.

Yeah sorry not in this kind of economy. I could've went to an event at Spectrum and spent less with alcohol included. Not to sham the tenants because rent must be expensive but to pay over $18 a person and not get even close to full on stall food is ridiculous.

Beautiful place - poor parking situation. Props to the city for trying but due to the expensive rent I don't know how any civilian can afford $20-25 a person in a FOOD Hall for some appetizers that are fit for a child

I don't want to be the jerk that leaves a one star for reasons outside of the food vendors control so not doing that... however we drove from Piper Glenn/Ballentine area of charlotte which is a bit of a commute to have dinner and experience this awesome venue as everyone raves about. Parked in parking deck attached to building and walk in to find the entire establishment was closed off for a private event! Car was parked literally for 8 minutes and had to pay $10.00!!! How are non locals supposed to enjoy this venue during normal business hours if they'll close the entire venue for a private event? Make it make sense....

Just had the lobster roll at Dock Local and it was super tasty! It's about 30 bucks for a roll with fries on the side. It's kinda expensive, but honestly, totally worth it. The lobster was juicy and flavorful, and those fries were just the right kind of crispy. The vibe of the place is pretty chill too. If you're into seafood, this roll is a must-try. It's a bit of a treat yourself moment, but who doesn't love one of those every now and then?
Lots of good food and cool vibes! Indoor and outdoor! The outdoor area is very nice and modern
The food was pretty good...

Ordered pickup from UberEats. Closing crew for Dock Local insisted he closed my order but actually didn't. Wasted my time waiting for my food that they weren't even making. I could've looked for another place, but by the time I realized they didn't make my order, it was already close to closing.
Terrible communication from the girl at the counter. She was giving me attitude when I told her my order is not at the pickup area.  The guy came up insisting that he voided my order earlier tried to play it off like they actually did it. I never got a notification on UberEats. He just printed me out my receipt. If I didn't insist on a void receipt it wouldn't have gotten a refund. Don't go here!!!!
Great food options, atmosphere is amazing. Gorgeous location

The food here is phenomenal, but the drinks at the bar are overpriced. $32 for a cocktail that has mid shelf liquor? Insane.

The food arrives quickly though, and everyone is friendly. There's a good number of choices for everyone, and I've greatly enjoyed it. Plenty of seating, too.
Did not eat but the place is very nice and has a lot od different options!

I was doubled charged $64 on my card last week when I came to the bar. I didn't notice until I went to go pay for something and realized they took $64 out on 7/3 then took another $64 from my account on 7/6. Tried contacting monarch market and found out their number is currently disconnected.. this is definitely an inconvenience!

I went to the Monarch Market for the first time yesterday, 6/22/24. I wanted to check out the vibe and atmosphere. Decided to go bar inside center of the food court. It wasn't busy at all and only 4 ppl sitting at the bar. So I sat and had a drink. The Bartender walks off to chit chat with a lady at the end of the bar he apparently knew. Approx 15mins past and everyone is calling out for his attention the entire 15mins & he decided to ignore EVERYONE & continued with his conversation. So I interrupted and said: Excuse me... we are all trying to get your attention. At this time he rolls his eyes and said: "I'm sorry, this job isn't important enough for me to rush to y'all aid. If the building ain't burning down & theres no real emergency you all can wait. That happened to be a good friend of mine I haven't seen in some years... so Excuse me if I wanted to catch up with her." I asked him if he remembered he is at work on the clock to do a service for the ppl /his customers. I'm sure you have lunch and breaks for that. At this point he started yelling and cursing at me telling me he didn't care and non of us are important enough for him to care.
This went on for some time until I asked for the Manager & he stated: Oh would you like me to FETCH. The manager for you like I care... you just hold on while I FETCH for you! This situation got so nasty for not reason at all! 1st and last time there if this is the type of employees they are hiring in their NEW ESTABLISHMENT! This was completely unacceptable, unprofessional, disrespectful & just disgusting overall! It is my mission at this time to let as many ppl know about the Monarch Market and my experience. I surely hope and pray the other patrons complain as well!
So very clean, service is great
The dumpling shop was not great at all Not what I expected for 14 dollars  skimpy on the meat not worth the prices
Best place in town for food. I had grilled cheese lobster sandwich and it was PHENOMENAL! I can't wait to go there again!
Absolutely delicious and lots of options. Will definitely come back.
LOVE Kabob 2 Go. The chicken shwarma wrap is delicious! I decided to place my order in advance and received a text that my order was ready while walking to the market.

It's mini food hall I didn't know existed! If you are working in the area, go ahead and oreder ahead online, our lunch break was 45 min from walking away and back to our desks with food in hand. I had the Korean stand (Seoul Good I think) and it was amazing. Waited only 10-12 minutes on my food to come out. Dishes are lunch sized and a bit higher priced due to the location but not bad enough for me to not make this place a regular stop. There are lots of options in here and a giant central bar with TV's to relax at (if not working lol). Will definitely need to drag my boyfriend here to meet me for a midweek lunch.
The atmosphere the ambience absolutely amazing. Love the vibe and love the sushi!
Food is sub par. We had 4 people that got food from 3 different vendors and all 3 were not very good and one was downright terrible.

Don't bother calling their number. Nobody ever answers. Been trying to reach them for days to get in touch with someone about getting a refund from one of the vendors. It's just been a huge headache since you can't reach either restaurant or Monarch Market....

I ordered Elote/Street Corn from Rolled AF and paid $5 total for the side.

This is what I ordered (see picture from their order page) vs what I got (see picture from my to-go that was 30min late).

I do not think a soggy half of a corn cob is worth $5. This was a major disappointment after spending half of my lunch break waiting to receive it.
Yummy choices, nice staff. Very clean.
Good luck getting here. No where to park. Waste of time
Great place to hangout with friends and family.

Finally a food market in the uptown area! Two bars and restaurants to represent all the major regions from around the world, including Japanese sushi, Mexican, Italian, southeast Asian, among others. Great place for a group gathering!
Nice place and vibes, but a Lillie expensive and very difficult to find parking !
Feels like a food court for adults

Nate is an excellent bartender - very informative about that food, activities, what to do if you are new in the area and he made the BEST mimosas I have ever had!  Must stop by for yummy food and to meet Nate and have his specialty drinks!

What establishment doesn't have a phone number to be able to contact them? Looked everywhere for one and when I was able to find it, from a screenshot of an order that someone else placed there, no one picks up. Like ever. It's just a dead end number. Trying to help someone locate an important item that was lost at the location.
Food court with variety of cuisine. It was very crowded on a Sunday afternoon.

This was such a wonderful place to grab a quick lunch. The service at each place we ordered from was excellent. My son wants to go back to get more dumplings. He said they were the best dumplings he's ever eaten. My daughter also loved the k-dog spot.
Decent food hall. Limited seating. Good variety. Professional clientele.
Lobster roll sucked and was pretty small for the price
It's pretty overpriced and the food is average. You're better off finding other places uptown for the same price for better food and more value.
Adorable space with incredible vendors. I look forward to coming back to try more of the options and to attend one of the events.
This is a very cute place to visit.
Really cool place!

We were really looking forward to checking this place out and it came up a little short of our expectations. With several food hall options in the area this one lacked with the parking and some of the food options. The inside felt a little like a mall food court. The outdoor bar looked pretty nice and we didn't check out the upstairs at all. Everyone tried something different and it was pricey.

Went recently and can't judge too much on the food since I only had a Korean corn dog but they were pleasant and good customer service. Got a drink at the bar and never got a receipt or the option to tip and I think the bartender gave himself a tip. I would have gladly given one and don't appreciate someone adding a tip automatically themselves  it is a cute place though and has a lot of potential!

It's still new, so not a ton of options...yet. However, what they did have made me really excited. I love Curry Gate, so I was happy to see them ( it is a smaller menu). The place that serves lobster rolls is so very tasty as well. I love to see that there is both an indoor and outdoor bar.

Recently had the chance checking out Monarch Market and I was definitely not disappointed. The entire market is nothing but a vibe from the bar outside to the many different eateries inside. It has something for tastebuds and a must try.

Another food court that does not have good food. The atmosphere and location are great for a pre show dinner. We tried the Indian stall, the Tikka masala and garlic naan was very bland. The Mexican stall burrito has undercooked rice that was crunchy. Maybe we tried the wrong stands, I would give it another try, but these places do everything, so I think they do nothing exceptionally well.
Love all the food options. We think the Aster is the coolest cocktail bar uptown. Worth the visit!
Great line up of vendors in here. Love the atmosphere and energy from the staff. Clean bathrooms with a well stocked bar. The Maverick at Smashed Burgers is a must try. Will be a regular here

I have been calling this place nonstop and left a voicemail about an order I was unable to pick up, but was paid for. I have gotten no calls back and no response about my refund. How can a newly built business not answer the phone at all?
Be ready to over pay for lunch,  all sauces are extra as well.

Found this place on Instagram, but it was much smaller in person. Great place to hang out, with extremely diverse selection of cuisines! Probably the most varied collection of restaurants in Charlotte. There is also a cool vending machine.

I usually don't do google reviews, but felt that my recent visit to Aster called for one. My experience was completely marred by the unprofessional behavior of one of the male bartenders. Shockingly, during my time at the bar, I witnessed this bartender openly using cocaine right in front of customers. Not only is this behavior illegal, but it is also deeply concerning and reflects poorly on the establishment's management and staff. Such disregard for basic professionalism and the law is utterly unacceptable. I urge management to address this issue immediately to ensure the safety and well-being of their patrons. I will not be returning to Aster until I am confident that appropriate measures have been taken to rectify this alarming situation.
Outstanding mixologists!

Purchased the Taquitos and bottle of soda.  $15.16.  They also gave me a bag of chips/quesos which I did not order, but they did charge me.  Food was bland.  Also, the checkout software suggests a tip of 18% + or a custom tip.  Will not be back.

Great market with a variety of restaurants that uptown Charlotte was missing.  From 12 to 1 p.m., the place was packed.  So I highly recommend you go earlier or later to grab lunch. Otherwise, you stuck there for half an hour.
Great news place for lunch. Energetic vibe and good food.
I really coming here for my first time. I will definitely come again.
Very cute!  Different food options so its not all the same.  We went on a cold day and can not wait for the warmer weather to enjoy the outdoor space!

Awesome food hall in Uptown. My friends and I tried a bunch of the food stalls and they were all impressive and the food was great. The variety of having a couple bars is nice as well. Shoutouts to Curry Gate, Brooklyn Dumpling Shop, Dock Local, Focaccina and Kabab2go. The sandwiches at Focaccina were incredible, the CT lobster roll at Dock Local was delicious and the others we tried were on point. Can't wait to go again.
Just opened, nice variety of food, we will be back!!
Love the many options. Very unique places here

We visited Monarch Market this past weekend and wow! This is such a cool place with an indoor and outdoor bar, room for outdoor seating and excellent margaritas. Can't wait for summer and slurp on a drink after work. We walked around and see all the different food stall and noticed the high prices. I understand the cost of food went up, however it won't be a good 9-5 option from Monday through Friday. $20 for a weekday lunch is not sustainable. However we had curry gate, and it was just as good as the original curry gate and the price was very reasonable. My Palak Paneer with jasmine rice was $12. It will definitely a go to place for a drink and once in a while for a special lunch.
Such good food, great atmosphere and service!
Nice collection of spots. I had Indian, but there were many options available.
it's ok. curry kebab burgers and sandwich places are good. but going to a restaurant is very similar in price

The place is right off of Tyron street and across from bluementhal ..

The bar has limited options and rather pricey.. for a 5 oz wine (most wines), it was $15 .. 5 oz wine is like taste testing

Too expensive for my taste

The food and vibe was nice.. wish they had more options though..
Food at the Burger place was good and juicey. People were very friendly.
Overall, the experience is pleasant. A great hangout place.

Loved stopping by this market to try the restaurants. Curry gate was a 10/10 experience. The food was so flavorful and the customer service was amazing. They are so lucky to have Monica. Her sweet nature will make all the clients want to return.

We tried Seoul for the k dogs and they were also fantastic! We can't wait to come back :)

It is an upscale food court. There are multiple international offerings but from the 3 our group chose it wasn't anything special. None of us got drinks and it was still around $18 each. The location is noisy and crowded. It is hard to see where the lines are vs where people are waiting for food. The trash cans are hidden and not easy to find.

For the price I can got to half a dozen restaurants around and sit down and get served without the hustle and bustle involved here.

This is an awesome place to eat,  no to expensive, quick, and delicious 
Right at Downtown Charlotte.

It is ok. Not worth going to unless you are already in town. Optimist and Camp Northend are better food halls.  It is kind of like a nicer corporate cafeteria. But nice happy hour bar to hang. If you are a banker taking a break from doing banker stuff it is good.

Nice, clean place with 8-10 food vendors. There is a bar in the middle and also outside in the front on the covered patio entry way. Our food was good, service was friendly and the bathrooms were clean.

Happy Saturday! So, I didn't eat anything prior to leaving for work today.  I went over to Monarch Market. They have a beautiful layout from outside to inside. They have mini good stations set up as to how you would see it inside of a mall at food court.  I walked around to each station as I was undecided on what I had a taste for, but I knew I wanted something delicious to eat. I chose, "Rolled AF." Interesting name, right? I ordered a "Birria crunchwrap." As, of course, it comes with the dipping sauce. When I tell  you, everything was amazing from the layers to the seasoning & perfectly sealed. It's so neatly stacked and fulfilling. I only ate 1/2 of the wrap. You can choose your choice of protein. It's not included.  I paid almost $17, but it's so worth it. It's a beautiful atmosphere for date nights or a girls /guys night out type of vibe.

Ehhh it's okay. Tried the shawarma place, the wrap tasted off, who puts pickles in a shawarma wrap? Fries were soggy even though I asked for them on the side not in the wrap...service was slow despite not being busy at all and having and abundance of staff. Overall, strange experience...there are other, better food halls in Charlotte, this one needs some work.
Go to the Italian spot and order the Regina, thank me later. My guy at the counter always takes care of me
Inverno Sandwich w/ Argula
Great place. You must check it out
What a cute place! I love the options available to eat. My seafood dip and volcano rolls from the sushi place really hit!!!! Will be returning again soon!

Great experience here! This is a great food court with a bar in the middle. There is plenty of seating and about 10 fast casual restaurants around to eat from. There is a good variety of food from sushi to burgers to Korean to kebabs. The restaurants are charging about 15-20 for one person dinner. We will definitely be coming back!
Beware of parking at LAZ at 101 South. While the food vendor validate the ticket, the parking charge $38 for 2 hours and said that the parking validation is only good for after 4pm.
Good food, bit expensive though.
Fantastic food hall!

Food is tasty, and a wide variety of selection, though very overpriced.  Validated parking is nice, though the parking lot was a hassle to find based on instructions online (go to the 101 lot, there is no signage for One Independence Center)
I wish it were more spacious but the vibes were great.
Un lugar super chevere,las opciones de comida muy amplias,muy buen sitio
The atmosphere is a vibe. Just be prepared to spend $$$.

Wonderful facility poor service. On tei occasions at Kabob2Go it too an excessively long time to receive my order. It's as of there was no organization on the first where I received the order after approximately 45 minute and 20 minute the second time. The dining hall itself is quite welcoming. There should be free water service available. The only option is to purchase it from the food stalls.
Great atmosphere
An amazing much needed addition to Uptown. Barley & Burger was great, going to try Rolled AF next
overpriced & not that great tasting food. went during opening week. tried 3 stands. maybe it will be better when less busy... right now it's like all the other expensive mid food in clt.

Ah, we ventured to the Mexican and Lao joints, but alas, their fare echoed the charm of airport cuisine--neither delectable nor wallet-friendly. The ambiance? Akin to an airport lounge, oozing a corporate aura down to the last decor detail. For the cost, I'll opt for a proper restaurant over this market-style setup.
Food choices are very rare for the pricing!

Crescent Communities has done it again! Found an area that had a need and they fulfilled it! This area needed a dining hall and then gave it to us. Great food and great drinks, you can meet with friends, family, and even hold a business meeting here. Working uptown has totally changed for me and my team!
Food is really expensive. Limited options to choose from, but overall it has potential.

Great to have another casual dining option in Uptown that's open for dinner! Wish they had online or kiosk ordering like other modern food courts so you didn't have to wait in line (some longer than others--perhaps due to inefficient order intake and not necessarily popularity) and then hope to find a table! They all use the same point of sale (receipts all say "Monarch Market"), so that shouldn't be hard.

The address listed on the website for the parking garage seems incorrect, but we ended up finding a spot on the street anyway.

Yes, some places seem pricey to make a full meal.  The $13.50 chick bap from Seoul Good was ok if you're not super hungry. Might need to add a Korean hot dog, which would be another $7. The focaccia sandwich I got from the Italian street food place was $12 and were a decent size. I just wish it had been hot, not room temp. The best value seemed to be the $10 Nam Khap (called a lettuce wrap, but basically fried rice ok top of lettuce in a prepackaged container) from the Laotion place.
This place is a whole vibe! Loved the bars.  The food is meh... more food court less food experience but it works. The ambiance is great. We enjoyed our visit and will go again.

Still some things they need to work out: Long lines to order(should have ipad stations at entrance to order at all food stalls to minimize lines at counter) and where to put trash.  Dumpling place wasn't open.  Barley and Burger has great smashed burger with prices comparable to other restaurants uptown.  The two bars are nice touches.  Will try the other restaurants soon.
Love the variety and great layout. Good spot to grab lunch or a drink for happy hour!

Delicious food and the service is impeccable. However, I noticed that all the drinks containing water or ice smells like "wet dog." There might be something contaminating the water supply for example the pipes. I overlooked it the first time, but noticed it a second time visiting.

Great new spot to eat, many choices of all kinds of food. All the usual fare..
Oder food and find a place to sit down.
Crazy busy!
I ate at focaccina, it was great!!!

I ordered at Tao cuisine, and the photo speaks for it self, for $13 I didn't expect rice in a bag and 1 sausage...
And it wasn't even good. Sausage was dry! And they tried charging me $1 for the smallest amount of sauce.
Other food at this location is better, stay away from this spot
Wonderful selection of places to eat.  Very nice and comfortable atmosphere.
I love love this place. The food options are amazing. I ate at Smashburger and it was perfection b
Great vibes and good eats! Bring a friend or come alone, there will always be something for you to order
